items.name: Ext.util.TaskRunner
fireIdleEvent
items.text: This may be configured `false` to inhibit firing of the Ext.GlobalEvents#idle after task invocation.

items.name: interval
items.text: How often to run the task in milliseconds. Defaults to every 10ms.

items.name: interval
items.text:
The minimum precision in milliseconds supported by
this TaskRunner instance. Alternatively, a config object to apply to the new instance.

items.name: newTask
items.text: Creates a new Ext.util.TaskRunner.Task instance. These instances can be easily started and stopped.

items.name: config
items.text: The config object. For details on the supported properties, see start.
Ext.util.TaskRunner.Task instance, which can be useful for method chaining.

items.name: start
items.text: Starts a new task. Before each invocation, Ext injects the property `taskRunCount` into the task object so that calculations based on the repeat count can be performed. The returned task will contain a destroy method that can be used to destroy the task and cancel further calls. This is equivalent to the stop method.

items.name: task
items.text: A config object that supports the following properties:

items.name: run
items.text:
The function to execute each time the task is invoked. The
function will be called at each interval and passed the `args` argument if specified,
and the current invocation count if not.

If a particular scope (`this` reference) is required, be sure to specify it using
the `scope` argument.

items.name: return
items.text: `false` from this function to terminate the task.

items.name: onError
items.text:
The function to execute in case of unhandled
error on task.run.

items.name: interval
items.text:
The frequency in milliseconds with which the task
should be invoked.

items.name: args
items.text:
An array of arguments to be passed to the function
specified by `run`. If not specified, the current invocation count is passed.

items.name: scope
items.text:
The scope (`this` reference) in which to execute the
`run` function. Defaults to the task config object.

items.name: duration
items.text:
The length of time in milliseconds to invoke the task
before stopping automatically (defaults to indefinite).

items.name: repeat
items.text:
The number of times to invoke the task before stopping
automatically (defaults to indefinite).

items.name: fireIdleEvent
items.text: If all tasks in a TaskRunner's execution sweep are configured with `fireIdleEvent: false`, then the Ext.GlobalEvents#idle is not fired when the TaskRunner's execution sweep finishes.

items.name: fireOnStart
items.text:
True to run the task immediately instead of
waiting for the _interval's_ initial pass to call the _run_ function.

items.name: stop
items.text: Stops an existing running task.

items.name: task
items.text: The task to stop
The task

items.name: stopAll
items.text: Stops all tasks that are currently running.

items.name: destroy
items.text: Destroys this instance, stopping all tasks that are currently running.

items.name: timerId
items.text: The id of the current timer.
